description: a(n) is the denominator of b(n) where b(n) is a sequence of rational numbers defined by the recursion: b(0) = 0, b(1) = 1 and for n>1 b(n) = b(n-1) + b(n-2)/2 . By this definition it is clear that a(n) is always a power of 2 (see A060755).
author: Avi Peretz (njk(AT)netvision.net.il), Apr 21 2001
